issue.title: Crackling audio when streaming audio from Koel music server to Chrome mobile browser on Android 13
issue.body:
GREAT SOFTWARE! I'm unable to use the App Store app due to it not supporting internal CA certificates so I must use the Chrome webapp instead when I want to listen to music on the go.

**Describe the bug**
Audio streams from the Koel music server to Chrome mobile browser on Android 13 are crackly, poor audio quality

**To reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
- Both music server and phone on the same LAN; high speed bandwidth between server and phone; not network issue
- Open webapp, sign in and start streaming a music file
- Music file plays fine but the audio quality is crackly/poor 
- Not issue with headphones/speakers as other apps play audio fine
- Issue does not occur when streaming audio from the Koel music server to a Chrome browser on Windows 10. Same server, same network same configuration, working perfectly, issue only seems to happen on chrome mobile.

**Expected behavior**
Clear audio streaming

**Screenshots**
n/a

**Environment**
 - Koel version Koel v6.11.2
 - OS: Android 13
 - Browser Chrome
 - PHP version PHP 8.1.2-1
 - Node version v20.3.1

**Additional context**
I am using the "php" streaming method in the Koel music server .env file. I tried to change this to "x-accel-redirect" but the documentation is not clear enough on what other steps needs to be configured. It assumes too much knowledge of the person doing the configuration, i highly suggest adding some extra information/documentation here as to how to configure these settings. Thank you :)

comment.body: I've also have this issue with Firefox on Android 13. From time to time sounds is crackling/tearing.

issue.title: Artist images not being pulled from last.fm
issue.body:
**Describe the bug**
My library is scanned and Koel is connected with my last.fm account. None of the artists images are refreshed from last.fm , still the placeholder image is showing for all artists.

**To reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Succesfully connect last.fm to Koel
2. Click on 'Artists'
3. None of the artist images are loaded

**Expected behavior**
Artist images are pulled from last.fm

**Screenshots**


**Environment**
 - Koel version [latest docker]
 - OS: [Docker]
 - Browser [Chrome Latest]

issue.title: Initial library scan fails
issue.body:
**Describe the bug**
After setting up koel, i issue the command to start searching for music. The system goes through scanning, but at 34% it fails with the following message:

`
root@33b602e314a6:/var/www/html# php artisan koel:sync                           
                                                                                 
   INFO  Scanning /music.                                                        
                                                                                 
 12074/35089 [=========>------------------]  34%                                 
   ValueError                                                                    
                                                                                 
  strpos(): Argument #3 ($offset) must be contained in argument #1 ($haystack)   
                                                                                 
  at vendor/james-heinrich/getid3/getid3/module.tag.id3v2.php:1821               
  4   app/Services/FileSynchronizer.php:52                                       
      getID3::analyze()                                                          
                                                                             
    1817▕                       $parsedFrame['description'] = substr($parsedFrame['data'], $frame_offset, $frame_terminatorpos - $frame_offset);                  
    1818▕                       $parsedFrame['description'] = $this->MakeUTF16emptyStringEmpty($parsedFrame['description']);                                      
    1819▕                       $frame_offset = $frame_terminatorpos + strlen($frame_textencoding_terminator);                                                    
    1820▕                                                                        
    1821▕                      $frame_terminatorpos = strpos($parsedFrame['data'], "\x00", $frame_offset);                                                       
    1822▕                       $frame_mimetype = substr($parsedFrame['data'], $frame_offset, $frame_terminatorpos - $frame_offset);                              
    1823▕                       $frame_offset = $frame_terminatorpos + strlen("\x00");        
    1824▕                                                                        
    1825▕                       $frame_sellerlogo = substr($parsedFrame['data'], $frame_offset);
                                                                             
      +3 vendor frames
        5   app/Services/FileSynchronizer.php:79                                       
      App\Services\FileSynchronizer::getFileScanInformation()`

**To reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Log on to docker container
2. php artisan koel:sync

**Expected behavior**
The library scan completes


**Environment**
 - Koel v6.11.2
 - OS: Latest docker

`

   INFO  Scanning /music.                                                        
                                                                                 
 12074/35089 [=========>------------------]  34%

      App\Services\FileSynchronizer::getFileScanInformation()`

**To reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Log on to docker container
2. php artisan koel:sync

**Expected behavior**
The library scan completes


**Environment**
 - Koel v6.11.2
 - OS: Latest docker

comment.body:
I was able to solve this by going into my library and retagging/auditing everything.

The error message was thrown because of a corrupted mp3, that had 0 bytes in size.
It would have been great if Koel logs out the filename that caused it to crash, it would have saved me a couple of days of work

issue.title: Sync out of memory

comment.body:
just ran into this issue myself. 

I was trying to add songs from LE SSERAFIM. The original tracks had tagging that wasn't in English, maybe that is the problem? 
When I re-tagged with Lidarr, it was able to sync. 

![image](https://github.com/koel/koel/assets/87589047/a9c45cc4-c207-4448-9554-315ec25b4229)

hope this helps!
